What is the best way to care for a mint plant in a pot?

The best way to care for a mint plant in a pot is to make sure the plant gets plenty of sunlight and water. Mint plants are herbaceous plants, so they don't like heat very much. However, if the plant is getting too much sun, you can place it in a shaded spot. It's also important to make sure the plant isn't too wet or the roots can rot. Additionally, you can fertilize the plant occasionally to help it grow.
What are the symptoms of overwatering?

Overwatering can cause root rot and also makes the plant susceptible to fungal diseases. If you notice any of these symptoms, you should try to let the plant dry out between waterings. If you think the plant is suffering from overwatering, try to water it less frequently and more thoroughly. Also, make sure the soil is well-drained.
